Table 2: Object detection with different frameworks on COCO val2017. For fair comparison, 
we initialize all ViT-S/B models with the regular ImageNet-1K pre-training (Touvron et al., 2021). 
"#P" denotes the number of parameters. "MS" means multi-scale training.

weights. Our method retains the flexibility of

caption:
Table 6: Ablation studies of ViT-Adapter. (Left) ablation of key components. Our proposed com-
ponents collectively bring 4.5 AP b and 2.8 AP m gains. (Right) ablation of the number of interactions 
N . The model gives the best performance when N = 4. SPM is short for the spatial prior module.

Table 7: Ablation of using different attention mechanisms in our adapter. The per-iteration 
training time and GPU training memory are measured by A100 GPUs with per-GPU batch size 2 
and FP16 training. "*" indicates using activation checkpointing to save training memory.

Table 8: Comparisons with the leading results on the COCO val2017 and test-dev sets. There 
are three detection frameworks used, including Cascade Mask R-CNN

Table 10: Configurations of the ViT-Adapter. We apply our adapters on four different settings of 
ViT, including ViT-T, ViT-S, ViT-B, and ViT-L, covering a wide range of different model sizes.
